memories.name: Team Growth Plans
memories.episode_body: Paul is ready for more senior responsibilities - consider promoting to Senior UX Designer in Q2. Quinn needs more mentorship on design systems strategy. Planning to hire additional UI designer in Q2 to support growing workload.

memories.name: Design Review Schedule
memories.episode_body: Team design critiques every Thursday 3-4 PM. One-on-ones with Paul on Mondays 1 PM, with Quinn on Tuesdays 10 AM. Design system working group meets bi-weekly Wednesdays 2 PM with frontend team.

memories.name: Olivia Taylor - Design Lead
memories.episode_body: Olivia Taylor leads the Design Team at TechFlow Solutions, managing Paul Anderson (UX Designer) and Quinn Roberts (UI Designer). Expert in design systems, user research methodology, and design strategy. 9 years design experience, previously led design at SaaS company.

memories.name: User Research Findings - Checkout Flow
memories.episode_body: User testing conducted January 2026 with 15 participants showed 73% of users struggled with payment method selection step. Key issues: too many options presented at once, unclear which cards are accepted, confusing error messages. Recommend simplifying checkout flow to maximum 3 steps with progressive disclosure pattern.

memories.name: TechFlow Design System
memories.episode_body: Design system uses Figma for design files and React component library for implementation. Follows Material Design principles with custom TechFlow brand colors and spacing. Component library includes 50+ components: buttons, forms, cards, modals, navigation. Design tokens define colors, typography, spacing, shadows.

memories.name: Checkout Redesign Approach
memories.episode_body: Redesigning checkout as 3-step flow: 1) Shipping information, 2) Payment method (simplified to 3 options), 3) Order review. Using progressive disclosure to hide optional fields. Added clear loading states and error handling. Designed mobile-first then adapted to desktop.

memories.name: Design-Engineering Collaboration
memories.episode_body: Design team works closely with Frontend team (Emily, Frank, Grace). Process: Design creates mockups in Figma, shares with engineering for feedback, iterates based on technical constraints, hands off with design specs and Figma dev mode. Weekly sync meetings to review implementation.

memories.name: User Research Methods
memories.episode_body: Team uses multiple research methods: usability testing (task-based), user interviews (open-ended), surveys (quantitative), analytics review (behavioral data). For checkout redesign, conducted 5 moderated usability tests and 10 user interviews.

memories.name: Progressive Disclosure in UX
memories.episode_body: Progressive disclosure is a UX pattern that shows only essential information initially and reveals additional details on demand. Reduces cognitive load and simplifies complex interfaces. Example: hide optional form fields behind 'More options' button.
